text: Sergio Gil Latorre (born 10 May 1996) is a Spanish footballer who plays as a central midfielder for Extremadura UD. ==Football career== Born in Zaragoza, Aragon, Gil graduated from local Real Zaragoza's youth setup. He renewed his link with the club on 7 August 2013,Sergio Gil amplía su vinculación con el Real Zaragoza (Sergio Gil extends his link with Real Zaragoza); Zaragoza's official website, 7 August 2013 and made his senior debuts with the reserves in the 2014–15 campaign, in Segunda División B. On 14 March 2015, Gil played his first match as a professional, coming on as a late substitute for Iñigo Ruiz de Galarreta in a 0–0 home draw against CD Lugo for the Segunda División championship.La mala racha que no cesa (The poor run which does not stop); Marca, 14 March 2015 Ahead of the 2016–17 campaign, he was definitely promoted to the first team, but failed to appear during the club's pre-season, considering that his contract extension signed in the previous campaign was not valid."Si Sergio Gil no sigue, tenemos que obtener las mejores contraprestaciones" ("If Sergio Gil does not remain, we will have to obtain the best counterparts possible"); Heraldo de Aragón, 21 July 2016 On 31 August 2016, Gil signed a three-year contract with fellow league team CD Lugo.Sergio Gil, nuevo jugador del CD Lugo (Sergio Gil, new player of CD Lugo); CD Lugo, 1 September 2016 On 13 July 2019, he moved to Extremadura UD also in the second division, as a free agent. ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Zaragoza Category:Spanish footballers Category:Aragonese footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Segunda División players Category:Segunda División B players Category:Real Zaragoza B players Category:Real Zaragoza players Category:CD Lugo players Category:Extremadura UD footballers
title: Sergio Gil Latorre
